full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## Title
EP916-241059 Peacekeeping Monument Rehabilitation

### Tender Description
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites bids for the project EP916-241059 Peacekeeping Monument Rehabilitation. The contract involves the rehabilitation of the existing National Peacekeeping Monument site, including associated electrical, concrete, and architectural/landscaping work.

### Objectives
The main objectives of this project are:

*   To address public safety hazards at the site, including surficial issues and improve lighting for improved safety and security of users at night.
*   To restore the monument to its original design intent.
*   To maintain and enhance the health and safety, security, and experience of the public by providing improved site amenities meeting current codes, standards, and best practices for key government objectives such as sustainability and universal accessibility.

### Tender Details
-   **Tender Closing Date**: April 2, 2024, 2:00 PM (Eastern Time)
-   **Expected Contract Start Date**: April 22, 2024
-   **Expected Contract End Date**: Not Applicable
-   **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
-   **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
-   **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
-   **Regions of Delivery**: National Capital Region (NCR)
-   **Contact Information**:
    -   Name: Dale Rudderham (SPAC/PSPC)
    -   Email: [dale.rudderham@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:dale.rudderham@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
    -   Phone: Not Available

### Relevant Attachments
The relevant attachments can be accessed through the following link: [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18931658](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18931658)

## Disclaimer
Please note that the listing details, including attachments and links, are subject to change. Bidders are encouraged to verify the information through the official government website. The Contractor is not responsible for any inaccuracies or outdated information.   I made some minor improvements to the english, breaking the text up into sections, making the headings more relevant and concise,  ensuring that the formatting and punctuation are clear and consistent, and making the language concise, clear, and easy to understand.
